job.title: Software Engineer
job.description: ECP is a market-leading SaaS software solution that enables long-term care facilities to better care for their residents. Already used in over 2,000 facilities across the United States, ECP is looking to further expand by increasing the number of customers that use our software and increasing the scope of how we serve our customers by developing and releasing new products.This role will join our software engineering team on projects in a variety of technologies including React, Node.js, TypeScript and ColdFusion. You will contribute to a variety of customer-facing and internal projects and will have plenty of opportunities to learn about both healthcare and diverse technologies inside a quickly growing company.We expect you to be able to hit the ground running and be able to take the lead on small to medium-sized projects within six months. This full-stack software engineer will report to the head of technology and have access to the rest of the leadership team. Primary Responsibilities:Contribute to day-to-day development: contribute tested, documented code to solve business problems.Continually improve their knowledge of the core languages and frameworks that we are invested in, especially React and Node.js. Stay intellectually curious and up to date on technical best practices.Work collaboratively in a team. Understand how to work productively with others, strong communication skills, and ability to use collaboration software such as Git.Develop an understanding of our overall product and platform. Understand how the work you contribute will fit into our overall development pipeline.Required Qualifications2-5 years of development experienceProficiency with React, Node.js or ColdFusionExperience with versioning systems (preferably git)Fluent English, grammatical skills Legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorshipPreferred QualificationsExperience with Cloud services such as AWS, Azure, or GCPExperience with a ticketing system such as Azure DevOps or JiraPerksCompetitive salaryMedical, Dental, and Vision insurance401(k) with matchWork from homeFlexible work schedulePaid time off + Sick LeaveParental leaveCasual attireOn-site gym and exercise equipmentComplimentary snacks and beverages Note: the company is hybrid in-office and WFH due to the pandemic.Equal Employment OpportunityECP is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes applications from all qualified applicants. We do not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
